Job Title: AVP Product Management, Data & AI Platform
Reasoning: Arron Chen demonstrates strong alignment with the Product Management Leader role, particularly in AI/ML implementation and data product leadership. His experience at BMO and RBC showcases building and deploying ML models, automating processes (Tableau, Playwright), and leading validation efforts. The resume highlights experience with LLMs, RAG, and federated learning, aligning with the 'AI Innovation' requirement. The 4+ years of experience slightly exceeds the minimum 7+ years, and the demonstrated leadership and cross-functional collaboration are significant strengths. No gaps in critical skills are apparent.
Job Description:
About the job
About League
Founded in 2014, League is the leading healthcare consumer experience (CX) platform, powered by artificial intelligence (AI), reaching more than 63 million people around the world and delivering the highest level of personalization in the industry. Payers, providers, and consumer health partners build on League’s platform to deliver high-engagement healthcare solutions proven to improve health outcomes. League has raised over $285 million in venture capital funding to date, powering the digital experiences for some of healthcare’s most trusted brands, including Highmark Health, Manulife, Medibank, and Shoppers Drug Mart.
The role
As League continues its rapid growth and seeks to revolutionize healthcare through technology, the strategic development and implementation of data products and AI solutions become paramount. We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Product Management Leader to lead the strategy of our Data & AI platform.
You will spearhead high-visibility, cross-functional initiatives, fostering strong relationships with key stakeholders across the organization and the broader healthcare ecosystem.
The ideal candidate possesses a proven track record in leading the development of complex, scalable data environments, successfully launching data products, implementing AI/ML solutions, enabling data-driven decision-making, and shaping comprehensive data analytics strategies. With a strong background in leading high-performing teams, this candidate will play a crucial role in guiding the innovative technologies/products to enhance our platform's data environment and deliver personalized, AI-powered experiences.
In This Role, You Will
Define Product Strategy & Vision: Lead and ensure cross functional alignment of our Data & AI platform strategy, ensuring it is meeting the needs of our portfolio of products & customers. 
AI Innovation: Advance League’s AI platform through experimentation and implementation of cutting-edge technologies. Product management oversight of AI Health Story, guardrails, evaluation, MCP tools, and more. 
Personalization & Engagement: Drive strategy to ensure our platform offers personalized user experiences that meet the highest quality standards, leveraging AI and machine learning to maximize customer engagement and lifetime value
Grow a Team of High Performing Product Managers: Provide expert-level coaching, mentorship, and feedback to support the product managers in your team; and ensure investments are exceeding our goals
Cross-functional Leadership: Partner with peers in engineering, growth, customer strategy, and marketing to ensure platform products are leveraged appropriately and that their value is conveyed to internal and external leaders.
About You
A minimum of 7+ years of experience in data science product management, data product management, or AI/ML implementation - US healthcare industry experience preferred
A minimum of 3+ years of experience in progressively responsible leadership roles (through to the senior management level), managing medium to large-sized teams and cross-functional initiative
Proven experience in building and launching successful data products from ideation to market
Strong understanding of AI/ML algorithms and techniques, with experience in applying them to real-world business problems.
Strong business acumen, with the ability to translate data insights and AI/ML models into tangible business value.
Strong collaboration, communication, and interpersonal skills, with experience building positive working relationships with senior leaders across the business.
Results-driven and forward-thinking, with the ability to influence and drive change across the organization.
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
What We Offer
Comprehensive Health Benefits: We prioritize your well-being with complete medical, dental, and vision coverage
Bonus Program: Be rewarded for your contributions with our performance-based bonus program
Employee Stock Option Program: Become an owner and share in our success through our stock option program
Unlimited Paid Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge and maintain a healthy work-life balance
Spending Accounts: Manage your healthcare and dependent care expenses with tax-advantaged spending accounts
Wellness Days: Prioritize your mental and physical health with dedicated wellness days throughout the year
Growth Opportunities: We invest in your future with abundant opportunities for professional development and advancement
Mentorship Program: Benefit from guidance and support from experienced leaders in your field
Flexible Ways of Working: Enjoy the freedom to work in a way that suits your life and boosts your productivity
Security-Related Responsibilities
Ensure access management is performed in compliance with the employee's role and responsibilities
Responsibility and accountability for executing League's policies and procedures within the department/ team
Notification of HR, Legal, Compliance & Security of any incidents, breaches or policy violations
Compliance with Information Security Policies
CANADA APPLICANTS ONLY: The Canada-specific compensation range below for this full-time position is exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for base salaries for the position across all Canadian locations. $224,200—$249,100 CAD
Our employees come from different backgrounds, and we celebrate those differences. We are looking for the best candidates for our open roles, but do not expect applicants to meet every qualification in order to be considered. If you are excited about what you could accomplish at League and believe you can add value to our team, we would love to hear from you.
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.
Our Application Process
Applying to a role you love can be exhausting, and understanding the next steps can feel vague and uncertain. You have done the hard part of submitting your application; let's do ours by sharing potential next steps

If we see alignment with League's needs, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your goals. The recruiter will also share the team-specific interview process depending on the roles you are exploring.
The final step is an offer, which we hope you will accept!
Prior to joining us, we conduct reference and background checks. Additional checks could be required for US Candidates, depending on the role you are exploring.

We have a mix of office-centric roles based in our vibrant Toronto office, and remote-eligible roles based anywhere in Canada or US. Each job posting will indicate where the role will be based. Regardless of the role’s posted location, all Toronto-area Leaguers (living within 65 km of our downtown HQ) collaborate in-office Monday through Thursday. Depending on your distance to the office, you’ll enjoy 10 or 20 Flexible Remote Days each quarter for focus and deep-work time. We are committed to fostering a meaningful work environment and connections for all Leaguers regardless of location.

Reasoning: Arron Chen demonstrates a strong alignment with the Senior Data Engineer role, particularly in building and deploying data pipelines and services. His experience at BMO, specifically building the SAR narrative generation pipeline (60% reduction in review time) and the alert classification model (15% precision improvement), showcases impactful results. The experience with Federated Learning and model monitoring further strengthens his profile. While the JD mentions GoLang, his Python expertise is a strong substitute. Overall, his experience and skillset are a good fit, exceeding several critical requirements.
Job Description:
About the job
About League
Founded in 2014, League is the leading healthcare consumer experience (CX) platform, powered by artificial intelligence (AI), reaching more than 63 million people around the world and delivering the highest level of personalization in the industry. Payers, providers, and consumer health partners build on League’s platform to deliver high-engagement healthcare solutions proven to improve health outcomes. League has raised over $285 million in venture capital funding to date, powering the digital experiences for some of healthcare’s most trusted brands, including Highmark Health, Manulife, Medibank, and Shoppers Drug Mart.
Position Summary
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will focus on the data services / software development element of building personalized & data driven healthcare data products and pipelines that power our League platform. You will help architect, improve on and support a highly available, secure and governed data platform. Examples of data services include API endpoints, production microservices, and backend tools.
In this role, you will work as part of a small multi-disciplinary team to establish and evangelize a data driven culture. This team will not only work with the product team closely but will also support non-engineering functions like Marketing and Business Strategy.
To thrive in this role, you are someone who works well in cross-functional teams and enjoys collaborating. Furthermore, you understand the business impact of your work and enjoy measuring and presenting it. You enjoy working with product management and other stakeholders to find the best solution to the problem at hand, iterate over it and can balance technical complexity with delivering customer value.
Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. You will be working on building microservices for real-time and batch processes, machine learning pipelines, and mission critical data services. You will have an opportunity to experiment with new frameworks and paradigms, and freedom to put cutting-edge tech in production to shape the future of digital health!
In This Role, You Will
Be a subject matter expert in League’s production data services which range from Cloud Functions to software built in the backend. 
Utilize a variety of distributed computing platforms and tools to build scalable & data pipelines & services. 
Drive architectural choices and data platform tools.
Translate business needs into data and analytics requirements, with attention to detail.
Be part of an on-call rotation to analyze, tune, troubleshoot and support League’s data infrastructure ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of data.
Use sound agile development practices (testing and code reviewing, etc.) to develop and deliver data products.
Guide and mentor data engineers.
About You
Minimum 5 years experience in software development or data engineering
Experience in python and/or GoLang, bonus if in the context of serverless infrastructure. 
Experience working with Cloud Infrastructure - preferably GCP.
Experience in implementing deployments, CICD, error handling and monitoring for scalable pipelines.
Experience in performing root cause analysis of production issues, performance tuning and optimization.
Ability to articulate tradeoffs of technical decisions and influence stakeholders.
Ability to weigh in on roadmap and articulate opinion on areas of investment for the team
Nice-to-haves
Experience in orchestration tools like Airflow.
Experience in developing real time and batch pipelines.
Experience in data modeling, data governance and data discovery tools.
Experience in healthcare datasets like EMR and Claims and interoperability standards like FHIR.
Security-Related Responsibilities
Compliance with Information Security Policies
Compliance with League’s secure coding practice
Responsibility and accountability for executing League's policies and procedures
Notification of HR, Legal, Compliance & Security of any incidents, breaches or policy violations

Reasoning: Arron Chen demonstrates a strong alignment with the Senior Marketing Analyst role. His experience at BMO and RBC showcases expertise in data analysis, automation, and dashboarding, directly addressing key responsibilities. The resume highlights proficiency in SQL, Python, Tableau, and Google Apps Script, all essential tools. The experience with Federated Learning and LLMs is a bonus. The 4+ years of experience slightly exceeds the 3+ year requirement. I'm capping the score slightly due to the lack of explicit Google Apps Script experience, though his experience with similar scripting languages suggests transferability.
Job Description:
About the job
Please note that we will never request payment or bank account information at any stage of the recruitment process. As we continue to grow our teams, we urge you to be cautious of fraudulent job postings or recruitment activities that misuse our company name and information. Please protect your personal information during any recruitment process. While Monks may contact potential candidates via LinkedIn, all applications must be submitted through our official website (monks.com/careers).
About The Role
As a Senior Marketing Analyst for the YouTube Marketing team, you will be a key analytical leader responsible for the integrity, performance, and strategic use of our marketing data. This role owns the full data lifecycle: from managing and optimizing the data infrastructure to conducting deep-dive analyses that uncover strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing scalable dashboards and analytical tools that empower the entire marketing team to make smarter, data-driven decisions. In this role, you will act as the crucial link between the marketing team's business questions and the complex data needed to answer them, translating your findings into clear and actionable recommendations.
To ensure seamless collaboration with our West Coast teams, candidates must be available to work during PST business hours.
Responsibilities
Data Infrastructure & Governance
Own and optimize the data pipelines that power our marketing analytics, ensuring the timely delivery, accuracy, and integrity of large-scale datasets.
Proactively diagnose and resolve complex data issues by debugging SQL scripts, auditing data sources, and collaborating with Data Engineering to enhance pipeline performance and reliability.
Lead data governance initiatives by establishing and enforcing best practices for data quality, consistency, and documentation across all marketing data platforms.
Develop and automate scripts for data validation, transformation, and migration to improve operational efficiency and ensure seamless data integration.
Advanced Analytics & Strategic Insights
Conduct complex, deep-dive analyses to measure the impact of YouTube marketing campaigns, identify performance trends, and provide actionable recommendations for growth and optimization.
Utilize advanced SQL and scripting to query, transform, and synthesize massive datasets from disparate sources, developing new methodologies and metrics to address evolving business questions.
Develop comprehensive reports and presentations that translate complex analytical findings into compelling narratives and clear, actionable insights for key stakeholders.
Decision Support & Analytics Tools
Lead the end-to-end development of marketing analytics tools, from designing and building to maintaining scalable and intuitive dashboards.
Partner with marketing stakeholders to gather requirements, translating their business needs into technical specifications and user-friendly dashboard features like new dimensions and filters.
Serve as a subject matter expert on marketing data, empowering the wider team to make data-informed decisions through effective tools and clear communication.
About You
The essentials:
3+ years of experience in a highly analytical and technical role, such as a Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Engineer, or a hybrid Marketing Analyst/Software Engineer, preferably within a marketing or product analytics team.
Expert-level proficiency in SQL And Google Apps Script for complex data querying, manipulation, and analysis of large datasets.
Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining data-driven solutions and platforms.
Proficiency in at least one scripting language (e.g., Python or R) for data extraction, transformation, automation, and statistical analysis.
Strong experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools (e.g., Google's internal dashboard systems, Google Sheets), with proficiency in Google Apps Script for automation and tool customization.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and experience working with large-scale data infrastructures.
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills to interpret data, derive insights, and make data-driven recommendations.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate technical details and analytical findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.
At Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.
Monks is committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We believe in integration, and we are committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner. We will do so by removing and preventing barriers to accessibility and by meeting our accessibility requirements under local accessibility laws.
This role is subject to our Return to Office (RTO) policy. If you reside within a commutable distance of one of our office locations, you will be expected to work from the office a set number of days per week. The specific details, including the number of required office days, will be in accordance with the company’s then-current RTO policy, which is subject to change from time to time.
Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.
Salary Range$100,000—$120,000 CAD
About Monks
Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI—managed by the industry’s best and most diverse digital talent—to help the world’s trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.
Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave™: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek’s first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.
We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

However, the lack of explicit experience in enterprise data architecture, data governance frameworks (DAMA-DMBOK, DCAM, FAIR), and tools like ER/Studio or Erwin significantly limits their suitability for a Data Architect Director role. Job Description:
About the job
Range
125,600.00 - 188,400.00 CAD
Job Description
Data Architect Director
Target Salary Range: $145,000 to $188,400
We are ready to take this game to the next level and need someone passionate to define, evolve, and govern the enterprise data and AI architecture to accelerate the organization’s use of artificial intelligence and data‑driven innovation. This role designs scalable data and AI ecosystems including data models, pipelines, metadata and model lifecycle management, and architecture patterns that support analytics and AI/ML solutions. The Data Architect Director works with business leaders, data stewards, product managers, and delivery teams to ensure data and AI assets are high‑quality, trusted, and ready for strategic use. Through technical guidance and thought leadership, the role helps the organization responsibly apply AI, strengthen decision‑making, improve efficiency, and achieve outcomes like better data quality, increased automation, stronger compliance, and effective AI operationalization.
YOUR ROLE IN THE GAME
Reporting to the VP Enterprise Data & Analytics, you will be empowered to:
Develop enterprise-wide data architecture and processes, leading the design and evolution of data strategies aligned with business and enterprise needs.
Build and maintain data architecture roadmaps that reflect organizational goals, emerging technologies, and best practices while avoiding vendor lock‑in. Influences stakeholders to support data strategies that improve analytics, governance, and operational efficiency.
Prepare business cases for data initiatives, including cost/benefit analysis, data quality improvements, compliance risk mitigation, and AI/ML readiness to guide prioritization and funding.
Establish and enforce enterprise data strategies, policies, standards, and practices to ensure data quality, security, privacy, and regulatory compliance, aligning with frameworks such as DAMA‑DMBOK, DCAM, and FAIR.
Lead the planning and implementation of innovative data solutions like lakehouse architectures, real‑time pipelines, metadata management, and AI/ML‑enabling frameworks, while partnering with analytics, architecture, and governance teams to ensure data is discoverable, trusted, and accessible.
Lead major data transformation efforts by identifying and prioritizing capability improvements, applying frameworks like TOGAF and DAMA‑DMBOK, shaping enterprise data strategies, defining supporting policies and standards, selecting enabling tools, assessing data‑related risks, and designing solutions that balance compliance, quality, security, and business agility. Also develops custom data models and architectures for complex or unique business scenarios that support analytics, AI/ML, and digital transformation.
Coach and support team members by assigning work based on skills and goals, monitoring quality, offering practical guidance, helping them navigate ambiguity, and connecting them with the right resources. Provides ongoing learning and development support to build capability across the team.
Education & Experience
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE GAME
Post-secondary degree in information technology, computer science, data science, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
Minimum eight (8) years’ experience in data engineering or related roles within technology or data-focused functions.
Minimum eight (8) years’ experience in data architecture, enterprise data management, or a closely related discipline, with a strong track record of designing and implementing enterprise-scale data solutions
Relevant Skills
Strong grounding in data strategy and governance, including data modeling, metadata management, master and reference data, data quality, and full data lifecycle practices. Experienced with enterprise data architecture across warehouses, lakes, lakehouses, data mesh, data fabric, and cloud‑native platforms such as Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud.
Skilled in solution design for modern data ecosystems, including APIs, ETL/ELT integration, streaming, pipelines, DevOps for data, cloud and hybrid environments, and security/privacy. Proficient with tools like ER/Studio, Erwin, dbt, Sparx EA, and ArchiMate, and familiar with methodologies such as TOGAF, DAMA‑DMBOK, DCAM, and FAIR.
Strong business and strategic capability, including understanding of business models, data monetization, cost‑benefit analysis, budgeting, risk management, and aligning data strategies and roadmaps to organizational goals. Experienced in requirements analysis, logical and physical modeling, enterprise platforms, and solution architecture.
Comfortable with product and project delivery practices like Agile, Scrum, and SDLC. Experienced in developing documentation, providing strategic recommendations, evaluating vendor solutions, and running PoCs to assess fit‑for‑purpose data technologies.
Experience designing and implementing data architectures, including data platforms, integration strategies, and governance frameworks in complex environments. Collaborates closely with business stakeholders, product owners, and cross‑functional teams to define roadmaps, architecture patterns, and scalable data solutions.
Background in lottery and gaming organizations or similar sectors is an asset, with an understanding of the related business capabilities and the technology solutions that support them.
Benefits Of Joining The Winning Team
Group Benefits Plan: Eligible employees and dependents have access to comprehensive, employer-paid group benefits coverage (permanent employees only).
Public Service Pension Plan: Participation in a highly desirable defined benefit pension plan.
Variable Pay Program: Participation in a performance-based incentive plan that recognizes organizational and individual achievements (permanent employees only).
Paid Time-Off: Competitive paid time-off provisions to support work-life balance and well-being.
Growth Focus: Become your best self with access to new opportunities and personalized support programs.
Comprehensive Learning: 24/7 access to robust online learning programs.
Equity, diversity, and inclusion: Core to OLG’s culture, empowering employees to bring their authentic selves and make a meaningful impact across Ontario.
To learn more about our organization and other opportunities visit our career site.
We look forward to hearing from you, interested applicants please apply online by Feb 3, 2026.
Personal information is collected by the Ontario Lottery & Gaming Corporation (OLG) and/or its third party service provider(s) under the authority of the Ontario Lottery and Gaming Corporation Act, 1999, SO 1999, c 12, Sch L and the Employment Standards Act, 2000, S.O. 2000, c. 41 (as amended) and will be used for the purpose of determining qualifications for employment with OLG and for recruitment modernization initiatives. The information will be managed in accordance with all applicable laws, OLG’s Protection of Privacy Policy (the Policy) and related policies and procedures. For any questions about this collection, please contact careers@olg.ca, 800-70 Foster Drive, Sault Ste. Marie, ON, P6A 6V2.

Job Description:
About the job
Hi! We’re LinkGraph, an SEO software company (and full-service digital agency) focused on engineering products and services that help websites improve their performance on Google. We are a rapidly growing organization with clients from Fortune 500 companies to leading Silicon Valley tech startups, and we're looking to bring on an amazing Head of AI Search to help us propel our growth.
Check out our careers page here: www.linkgraph.com/careers
If you’re smart, ambitious, and passionate about working for a tech company, we want to hear from you!
Requirements
This role is expected to work in EST.
We are seeking a senior-level SEO leader with deep expertise in technical SEO and AI-driven search systems to lead strategy, mentor a high-performing team, and drive exceptional results for enterprise clients. This is a highly client-facing role that blends hands-on execution, strategic leadership, and thought leadership in the evolving AI search landscape.
You will own advanced SEO strategy development, guide a team of SEO strategists, and serve as a trusted advisor to clients—particularly at the executive level—while staying ahead of algorithm changes and emerging AI search technologies.
Key Responsibilities
Strategy & Execution
Develop and implement advanced SEO strategies, including AI search optimization and enterprise-scale initiatives
Analyze search engine algorithm updates and assess impact on client performance and strategy
Personally manage and execute strategy for high-value and complex client accounts
Lead competitive analysis and market positioning for client campaigns
AI Search
Design and execute strategies for Google SGE and AI-powered search experiences
Optimize for LLM-driven discovery (ChatGPT, Bing Chat, AI Overviews)
Lead entity SEO, knowledge graph optimization, and semantic search initiatives
Apply AI content quality frameworks and detection best practices
Leverage prompt engineering techniques to improve search visibility
Client Leadership
Join client calls alongside the Customer Success team to present strategy, performance, and recommendations
Confidently communicate with C-suite and senior stakeholders
Proactively address client concerns and reinforce confidence in SEO direction and results
People Leadership
Manage, mentor, and develop SEO team members (3–5+), including weekly 1:1s and strategy reviews
Provide hands-on guidance, feedback, and professional development support
Ensure team output aligns with best practices, internal methodologies, and client goals
Thought Leadership
Contribute to internal and external thought leadership around SEO, AI search, and industry trends
Help shape and evolve company SEO methodologies and best practices
Success Metrics (KPIs)
Overall team performance and development
Client SEO performance and goal attainment
Client retention and satisfaction
Contribution to thought leadership and innovation
Required Skills & Experience
SEO & Technical Expertise
Expert-level technical SEO knowledge, including:
Crawling and indexing
Core Web Vitals and page experience Structured data
Log file analysis
Proven experience with enterprise SEO strategy and large-scale site optimization Deep understanding of modern AI search systems (LLMs, vector databases, semantic search, BERT/MUM)
Strong familiarity with the Search Atlas platform and methodology
Tools & Platforms
SEO Tools: Search Atlas Suite, Screaming Frog, DeepCrawl, Botify
Analytics & Data: Google Analytics 4, Google Search Console API, BigQuery
Testing: A/B testing platforms and statistical significance analysis
Reporting & Dashboards: Looker, Airtable
Leadership & Communication Requirements
Experience managing SEO teams of 3–5+ people
Strong client-facing presentation and communication skills
Comfort engaging with executive and C-suite stakeholders
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights
Benefits
15 Days PTO + Christmas Day + New Years Day paid off
Salary
$5,000 - $7000 USD a month
Our Recruitment Process
Initial screening call with our recruitment team
Technical assessment to showcase your skills (if applicable)
Final interview with our Hiring Manager
Offer extended
Life at LinkGraph
We are committed to fostering a healthy work-life balance, innovation, and a collaborative, inclusive culture - no matter where you work. We host monthly virtual game days and events, and our team enjoys the flexibility of contributing to charity initiatives of their choice. We believe in supporting both personal growth and professional success, ensuring that remote work doesn’t mean disconnected work.
Here’s a Look Into Our Core Values
Collaborative & Engaged: We’re a tight-knit team that supports each other and shares knowledge.
Excellence Driven: We aim for the highest standards, always raising the bar.
Self-Starter Mentality: We take initiative and problem-solve independently.
Innovative: We embrace change, experiment, and think outside the box.
Student Mentality: We learn from our mistakes and constantly evolve.
Why Join Us?
We’re Proud Of The Recognition We’ve Received For Our Growth And Commitment To Creating a Positive, Inclusive Work Environment. Here Are Just a Few Of The Accolades That Highlight Our Success And Culture
Nevada’s Top Workplaces - #1 Small Business (Under 150 Employees), Best New Ideas
Best Start-Up Agency (U.S. Search Awards)
Top B2B Companies (Clutch)
Inc’s On The Rise and Best Places to Work (Inc. Magazine)
Great Place to Work Certified (Great Place to Work)
These awards reflect the hard work, dedication, and passion of our entire team, and we’d love for you to be a part of it!

Job Title: Stagiaire en développement logiciel, doctorat, été 2026
Reasoning: Arron Chen is a strong candidate for this internship, demonstrating a solid foundation in software development and machine learning. His experience at BMO and RBC showcases practical application of skills like XGBoost, LightGBM, and Python, with quantifiable achievements like a 60% reduction in manual review time and a 15% improvement in alert precision. The use of Playwright for web automation and experience with MLOps tools like Dataiku and Azure further strengthens his profile. The Master's degree and strong GPA are also positives. Experience level aligns well with the requirements. No critical skills are missing.
Job Description:
About the job
Les candidatures seront examinées sur une base continue; les candidats ont donc intérêt à postuler rapidement. La période de dépôt des candidatures prévue est ouverte jusqu'au 27 février 2026, mais peut se terminer plus tôt si tous les projets disponibles sont comblés. Les candidatures soumises après la période de dépôt des candidatures ou une fois que le poste est fermé ou que les projets sont comblés ne seront pas prises en compte.
Le délai de réponse peut varier et peut prendre plus de 90 jours. Si vous n'avez pas eu de nouvelles de votre candidature au bout de trois mois, il est probable que nous ayons choisi d'autres candidats pour le poste en question. Toutefois, nos recruteurs peuvent communiquer avec vous si nous trouvons un autre poste correspondant à vos compétences, à vos intérêts et à votre expérience.
Pour participer au programme de stage, vous devez résider au Canada pour la durée de ce dernier.
Ce stage est destiné aux étudiants qui en sont à leur avant-dernière année d'études et qui suivent un programme de doctorat en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.
Google est une entreprise mondiale et, afin de faciliter la collaboration et une communication efficace à l'échelle mondiale, la maîtrise de l'anglais est une exigence pour ce programme de stage.
Pour lancer le processus de candidature, vous aurez besoin d'un CV à jour et d'un relevé de notes actuel, officiel ou non, en anglais. Cliquez sur le bouton « Postuler » sur cette page et fournissez le matériel requis dans les sections correspondantes (en format PDF, de préférence) :
 Dans la section « CV », joignez un CV à jour.
Veuillez vous assurer que votre date de diplomation prévue (dans le format MM/AA) est inscrite sur votre CV.
 Dans la section « Éducation », joignez un relevé de notes officiel ou non officiel récent, en anglais.
Sous « État du diplôme », sélectionnez « En cours » pour téléverser un relevé de notes.
Joignez-vous à nous pour un stage payé unique de 12 à 14 semaines qui propose un développement personnel et professionnel, une série de conférences de dirigeants et une création de communautés. Le programme de stage en développement logiciel vous donnera l'occasion de travailler sur des solutions informatiques complexes, de développer des systèmes logiciels distribués évolutifs et de collaborer à une multitude de projets de moindre envergure, mais d'attrait universel.
Nous proposons une série de stages en développement logiciel ou en fiabilité des sites dans toute l'Amérique du Nord, y compris au Canada et aux États-Unis. Notre équipe de recrutement déterminera le stage qui vous conviendra le mieux en fonction de votre CV.
Ce poste concerne un poste vacant à venir.
Remarque : En postulant à cette offre, vous pourrez indiquer où vous préférez travailler parmi les propositions suivantes : Waterloo, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada.Qualifications minimales:
Poursuite d'un programme de doctorat axé sur des sujets liés au développement logiciel ou à d'autres champs techniques connexes
Expérience en codage dans l'un des langages de programmation suivants, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter : C, C++, Java, JavaScript ou Python
Qualifications souhaitées:
Poursuite d'un cursus au Canada et disponibilité pour travailler à temps plein pendant au moins 12 semaines en dehors du programme universitaire
Qui en est à son avant-dernière année d'études, ou retour prévu à un cursus après la fin du stage
Expérience de recherche dans les domaines des algorithmes, de l'architecture, de l'intelligence artificielle, des compilateurs, des bases de données, de l'exploration de données, des systèmes distribués, de l'apprentissage automatique, du réseautage ou des systèmes
Expérience en informatique, en structures de données, en algorithmes et en conception logicielle
À propos de cette offre d'emploi
En tant que stagiaire en développement logiciel, vous travaillerez sur un projet particulier qui est essentiel aux besoins de Google. Google s'efforce de faire progresser l'état des réalisations en matière d'informatique et de développer la nouvelle génération de systèmes intelligents pour tous les produits Google. Pour ce faire, nous travaillons sur des projets qui utilisent les dernières techniques informatiques développées par des développeurs logiciels compétents. Qu'il s'agisse de façonner l'avenir du développement durable, d'optimiser les algorithmes ou de lancer des systèmes d'IA avant-gardistes, nos équipes s'efforcent continuellement de faire progresser la science, de faire avancer la société et d'améliorer la vie de milliards de personnes.
Stagiaire en développement logiciel :
En tant que membre clé d'une équipe polyvalente, vous travaillerez sur un projet particulier qui est essentiel à la satisfaction des besoins de Google. Nos développeurs doivent être polyvalents et être enthousiastes à l'idée de s'attaquer à de nouveaux problèmes, pendant que nous continuons à faire progresser la technologie. Vous concevrez, testerez, déploierez et gérerez des solutions logicielles alors que vous progresserez pendant votre stage.
Stagiaire en fiabilité des sites :
Nos développeurs créent, corrigent, étendent et adaptent le code pour en assurer le bon fonctionnement, et en renforcer la capacité à résister aux actions des personnes mal intentionnées sur Internet. Nous optimisons la fiabilité et la performance à grande échelle. Vous travaillerez sur des projets de développement logiciel visant à assurer le bon fonctionnement d'importants systèmes essentiels pour l'entreprise, du dépannage du code des anomalies du trafic à la maintenance de nos services de pointe, en passant par la surveillance, les alertes et la construction d'une nouvelle infrastructure d'automatisation.
Google est, et sera toujours, une entreprise de développement. Nous embauchons des personnes possédant un large éventail de compétences techniques, prêtes à relever certains des plus grands défis technologiques et à avoir une influence sur des millions, voire des milliards, d'utilisateurs. Chez Google, non seulement les développeurs révolutionnent la recherche, mais ils travaillent aussi régulièrement sur des solutions de stockage et d'évolutivité, sur des applications à grande échelle, et sur de nouvelles plateformes pour les développeurs du monde entier. De Google Ads à Chrome, d'Android à YouTube, des réseaux sociaux aux applications locales, les développeurs de Google transforment le monde, une réussite technologique à la fois.
Le salaire de base canadien pour ce poste à temps plein est de 96,000 CAD, déterminé par le rôle, le niveau et l'emplacement. La rémunération individuelle est déterminée par des facteurs supplémentaires, notamment les compétences liées à l'emploi, l'expérience et l'éducation ou la formation pertinente. Veuillez noter que les détails de la rémunération indiqués dans les offres de poste au Canada reflètent uniquement le salaire de base et n'incluent pas les primes, les actions ou les avantages sociaux. En savoir plus sur les avantages chez Google .
Responsabilités
Créer et soutenir une équipe productive et novatrice, notamment en travaillant avec des pairs, des gestionnaires et d'autres équipes
Créer des scripts pour automatiser les tâches routinières
Appliquer les connaissances acquises dans les cours d'informatique à des défis concrets
Analyser l'information et évaluer les résultats afin de choisir la meilleure solution pour résoudre efficacement les problèmes
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Job Title: Senior Associate, Performance Measurement and Analytics
Reasoning: Arron Chen demonstrates a strong fit for the Senior Associate role, particularly with his experience in performance measurement, model validation, and automation. His experience at BMO, specifically building the SAR narrative generation pipeline (60% reduction in review time) and deploying the alert classification model (15% precision improvement), aligns well with the role's analytical and reporting responsibilities. The experience with XGBoost, LightGBM, and Tableau is also a plus. While the JD mentions Eagle PACE and Bloomberg, these are not explicitly demonstrated. Overall, his experience and skillset are a strong match, exceeding the experience requirement and showcasing a clear ability to deliver value.
Salary: The base salary range for this position is CAD $90,000.00 - $120,000.00
Job Description:
About the job
At IMCO, our talent is among the best! IMCO offers a uniquely stimulating and rewarding environment where you can help build and drive organizational transformation, all while seeking to challenge yourself, learn, and grow your career.
Our culture is built on collaboration and passion, with a shared commitment to delivering lasting value to the clients we serve. Located in downtown Toronto, our vision is to be the partner of choice for Ontario’s public sector funds and to build a high-performing, value-driven asset management firm.
This job posting is for an existing vacancy. If you are ready to deliver best-in-class service and join a collaborative, motivated and fun team of professionals, IMCO offers the opportunity to do impactful work and broaden your expertise.
If you’re looking to use your expertise to drive strategic outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.
‎
IMCO is looking for a highly motivated Senior Associate to join the Performance Measurement and Analytics team!
This is a 12 month contract role.
The Senior Associate is a key member of the Investment Analytics team, tasked with managing complex investment performance and analytical reporting for multi-billion dollar clients. This involves performance calculations, analysis, exposure reporting, asset mix, responding to internal stakeholder requests, client requests, and investigating discrepancies. The Senior Associate ensures the availability and accuracy of performance data provided to various stakeholders in a timely manner.
Working closely with Data Management & Investment Reporting, Investment Risk, Investment teams, Operations, external providers and IT, the Senior Associate provides and drives reporting solutions and establishes data integrity checks, performs reasonability checks, and ensures policies and procedures are followed. The position will take on training responsibilities of junior team members as needed by directing and mentoring team members in the execution of routine tasks, the production of a variety of reports, and the use of various systems. The role reports to the Senior Manager/Manager, Performance Measurement and Analytics.
Areas of Responsibility:
Producing, developing, and presenting investment-related reports and analysis across multiple disciplines to enhance the management and monitoring of investment performance of the plan.
Conducting research and analysis on Investment performance with significant attention to detail. 
Assisting in evaluating proposed calculation methodologies and financial models for operational reasonableness.
Developing regular and ad-hoc performance measurement and attribution models to support the investment decision making process, as well as the investment review process.
Managing, monitoring, and evaluating performance, risk management and attribution at various portfolio levels in a timely manner.
Establishing, maintaining and enhancing working relationships with key stakeholders.
Providing analytical and value-add support to internal stakeholders to support investment decision making, as well as transform data into meaningful and actionable knowledge by analyzing reports and providing recommendations.
Collaborating with front-office investment professionals to obtain and understand detailed reporting and information requirements.
Collaborating with the Data Management team to support the development and enhancement of the reporting environment and processes to better facilitate and customize the delivery of information for IMCO's end-users, including the definition of data classifications required, as well as assisting in establishing the processes to translate the book-of-record into usable inputs for the requested reporting. 
Collaborating with the Client Relationship Management team to better facilitate and customize the delivery of information for clients.
Proactively identifying opportunities for process improvement while simultaneously collaborating with co-workers to implement changes. 
Maintaining an up-to-date knowledge on investment market conditions and trends to support projects, as required. 
Providing appropriate and timely information, analysis and reporting for management, as well as the Board.
Provide detailed training and coaching to new Associates such that they can work independently to provide timely and accurate reporting.
Provide audit (secondary) reviews of Associate work to ensure accuracy.
Support department lead with third-party governance initiatives as assigned.
Participate as required in several strategic IMCO projects, working closely with department lead to: Communicate progress on assigned tasks effectively, escalate concerns and potential risks; and Provide thought leadership and subject matter expertise as required.
Other duties as assigned.
What do you need to succeed?
4 to 7 years of relevant experience in the financial services industry (preferably in asset management or capital markets) is required, including 3 years’ experience with performance measurement.
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Business or a related field is required. A graduate degree (e.g., MBA, MFin) and/or a professional designation (e.g. CFA, FRM, CIPM) is preferred.
Solid understanding of finance, portfolio management theory and broad range of asset classes, investment strategies, and investment vehicles including practical aspects such as market conventions, specific product knowledge, and best industry practices.
Advanced quantitative, analytical, financial modelling skills with comprehensive financial analysis experience.
Well-versed in performance measurement principles, methodologies and practices, with previous experience with P&L attribution and analysis considered an asset.
Written communication skills required to report complex information (e.g. risk reports, compliance issues, performance attribution) in a clear, concise manner.
Strong verbal communication and interpersonal skills required to exchange complex information and to present information, as well to build key working relationships; cultivate partnerships and work collaboratively in a team environment, and with internal and external resources.
Proficient with MS Suite (Excel, Word, Access). 
Proficient with Power BI, SQL, VBA and Python.
Knowledge of any other programming language is an asset.
Experience with Eagle PACE and Bloomberg is desired.
‎

Salary: Disrupt a massive market and take us to a $10B business in the next few years
Job Description:
About the job
You could work anywhere. Why us?
Join a pre-IPO startup with capital, traction and runway ($240M funded | 60X revenue growth in 5 years | $2T market size)
Partner with our VP of BizOps & Analytics, Armando La Rocca (ex-BCG, Better)
Disrupt a massive market and take us to a $10B business in the next few years
Be immersed in a talent-dense environment and greatly accelerate your career growth
About The Opportunity
Jerry is looking for a Senior Associate, Business Operations to join our growing team! We hit a huge milestone in early 2024 by achieving profitability and have ambitious goals for the next few years — scale from 5M to 50M customers and become a $10B business. As a Senior Associate, Business Operations, you will play a key role in championing data-driven decisions across the company’s most critical business initiatives (including carrier growth and development, building new products from 0-1, etc.). As part of the business operations & analytics team, you will leverage advanced machine learning models to conduct in-depth analyses and extract insights that will shape our growth strategies.
Jerry is building the first super app to make car ownership affordable and accessible – insurance, buy/sell, registration, loans, safety, repairs, parking, etc – a $2T market in the U.S. We started with insurance in 2019, and since then we’ve launched loan refinancing, driving insights, repair marketplace, car diagnostics, and a GenAI-powered chatbot & voicebot. We have amassed over 5M customers, raised $240MM in funding, scaled our revenue 60X and our team to 225 across 6 countries.
Here's what an ex-McKinsey teammate has to say about joining Jerry:
"I’ve really enjoyed working at Jerry because it’s allowed me to flex the strategy muscles I built at McKinsey while also getting much closer to implementation. Unlike traditional consulting, I’m not just handing off a recommendation — I actually get to own the metrics, design A/B tests, and see how our strategies play out in the real world.
Jerry has a deeply data-driven culture. We A/B test everything, and there’s been a big investment in data infrastructure — from clean, well-structured data to a strong data engineering team that supports real decision-making. As a result, the data and BizOps team is seen as a core strategic partner within the company.
Another thing I’ve appreciated is the team itself. A lot of people here come from MBB, so I’ve still got the energy, sharp thinking, and high bar that I had at McKinsey — but now I also get to build, test, and iterate on the strategies I help develop. It’s a great mix of ownership, rigor, and impact."
How You Will Make An Impact
Partner with marketing, product, and business development teams to integrate customer performance insights into user and partner acquisition strategies
Lead the design, execution, and analysis of A/B experiments on new and existing features, extracting key insights to inform product and business strategies
Define, understand, and test levers to drive profitable and scalable user acquisition and partnership growth
Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and optimize operational efficiency 
Preferred Experience
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitatively or intellectually rigorous discipline
2+ years of management consulting experience from a top firm (McKinsey, Bain, and Boston Consulting Group preferred) OR relevant experience in business analysis/operations
High level of comfort with SQL and/or running complex data analysis
Who You Are
You have a framework for problem solving and live by first principles
You are comfortable communicating with audiences varying from front-line employees to the company’s C-suite
You set a very high bar for yourself and for your team, and you are constantly pushing that bar higher in the pursuit of excellence
While we appreciate your interest and application, only applicants under consideration will be contacted.

About Jerry.ai
Jerry.ai is America’s first and only super app to radically simplify car ownership. We are redefining how people manage owning a car, one of their most expensive and time-consuming assets.
Backed by artificial intelligence and machine learning, Jerry.ai simplifies and automates owning and maintaining a car while providing personalized services for all car owners' needs. We spend every day innovating and improving our AI-powered app to provide the best possible experience for our customers. From car insurance and financing to maintenance and safety, Jerry.ai does it all.
We are the #1 rated and most downloaded app in our category with a 4.7 star rating in the App Store. We have more than 5 million customers — and we’re just getting started.
Jerry.ai was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $240 million in financing.
Join our team and work with passionate, curious and egoless people who love solving real-world problems. Help us build a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.

Job Description:
About the job
Mandatory in‑office attendance on designated days of the week, with the possibility of increasing required in‑office days over time.
The Wealth Reporting, Analytics and Automation will develop analytical and reporting solutions in close consultation with business stakeholders and functional partners, that are related to Wealth Analytics, reporting, automation and Legal, Regulatory and Compliance (LRC) requests as well as supporting broader data analytics responsibilities of the team. They will have strong ownership over all deliverables and guide on the configuration, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization solutions to support these deliverables.
This role will support Wealth Analytics, reporting, automation and Legal, Regulatory and Compliance projects and generally support advanced analytics and data management.
Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business groups.
Manages complex or challenging stakeholders through strong influencing and persuasive communication skills, ensuring alignment between business objectives and data needs.
Performs wealth analytics, reporting, automation, and transformation activities.
Applies LRC (Legal, Regulatory & Compliance) standards to ensure accuracy, timeliness, and clear communication.
Leads or participates in the design, implementation, and ongoing management of new analytics and reporting solutions.
Breaks down strategic issues and analyzes data to provide subject‑matter insights and actionable recommendations.
Structures and organizes data across multiple dimensions and granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, accounts, products, transactions).
Cleanses, manipulates, and transforms data through programming or scripting to support model development and validation.
Validates and tests analytical and reporting models to ensure performance, compliance, and reliability.
Promotes automation/optimization, self‑serve analytics adoption, and a culture of data‑driven decision making.
Monitors tool performance, manages UAT activities, and resolves technical or functional issues.
Integrates data from multiple sources to streamline processes, enhance analysis, and improve reporting efficiency.
Designs and produces recurring and ad‑hoc reports and dashboards.
Builds data visualizations and reporting solutions to communicate insights effectively to diverse audiences.
Develops tools and delivers training programs to enable non‑analytical users to adopt reporting and self‑serve analytics tools.
Documents and maintains procedures and processes related to analytics and reporting.
Supports business groups within BMO and, when required, provides insights with broader enterprise scope.
Provides specialized consulting, analytical, and technical expertise.
Exercises sound judgment to identify, diagnose, and resolve problems within established guidelines.
Demonstrates strong ownership and accountability; works independently or collaboratively while handling non‑routine situations.
Performs additional responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications:
7+ years of relevant analytical experience (preferably within FinTech or banking), supported by a post‑secondary degree in a related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Advanced proficiency in SAS (including SAS Macros) and SQL.
Strong expertise in data visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI and Fabric.
In‑depth experience with ETL processes, data preparation, data analysis, optimization, and automation.
Familiarity with additional statistical or analytical toolsets—such as Python, Spotfire, Tableau, R, MATLAB, and SPSS—considered an asset.
Demonstrated deep technical knowledge and analytical proficiency gained through extensive business experience.
Proven experience leading or owning LRC (Legal, Regulatory & Compliance) related deliverables.
Background in campaign analytics is required.
Knowledge of insurance is an asset.
Strong, demonstrated stakeholder management capabilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong collaboration and teamwork abilities.
Advanced analytical thinking and problem‑solving capabilities.
Strong influencing and negotiation skills.
Highly developed data‑driven decision‑making skills.
Salary:
$69,000.00 - $129,000.00
Pay Type:
Salaried

Job Description:
About the job
The Deadline To Apply For This Role Is
Until 11:59 PM of January 26, 2026
The opportunity
May 2026 - April 2027
The Total Fund Risk team within Risk is responsible for conducting risk analyses on OTPP’s entire portfolio spanning a range of asset classes including Equity, Fixed Income, Credit, Inflation Sensitive, and Real Assets. The team is a key contributor to risk governance and investment planning at the fund and is mandated to four major areas of work: (1) Investment Asset Risk; (2) Funding Liquidity Risk; (3) Portfolio Analytics; and (4) Investment Risk Reporting.
We are looking for a creative and lateral thinker who would be keen to contribute to the group’s efforts towards high quality investment risk analysis to the OTPP Board and the Plan’s C-suite executives. The Co-op Student will be responsible for a variety of reporting, monitoring and analytical activities as well as research and development initiatives that support the strategic objectives of the Total Fund Risk team. This individual will help improve investment risk modeling, analysis, and reporting of the entire OTPP portfolio.
Who You’ll Work With
You will work with dedicated team members to report asset and liquidity risks of the entire OTPP portfolio and improve total fund risk reporting and analytics.
What You’ll Do
Assist in the preparation of reports and presentations to senior leaders and the Board of Directors on risk modeling, budgeting and monitoring 
Implement and cater to on-demand requests from Risk and various investment departments across the Fund 
Research initiatives and conduct analyses supporting risk modeling and monitoring processes for the enterprise risk system 
Research and provide risk insights in the context of an evolving macro environment 
Work cross-functionally with other team members and departments to design/develop/enhance analytics tools for investment decision-making, ensuring continued alignment with OTPP’s Vision, Mission, and Values
What You’ll Need
Currently pursuing an undergraduate or master’s degree with a concentration in Computer Science, Finance, or Mathematics 
Enrollment in 3rd year or higher required 
Proficiency in Python, Excel, VBA 
Working knowledge in PL/SQL, Power BI 
Knowledge of and strong interest in financial markets and risk management 
Quantitative and qualitative problem solver 
Strong attention to detail and accuracy 
Proven ability to work independently as well as to perform effectively in a team-oriented environment 
Excellent communication skills, strong interpersonal skills 
Self-motivated, flexible, and adaptable 
You should be returning back to your studies after the work term is completed 
Intern Application Guidance
Although the deadline for this posting is January 26th, 2026, we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. We recommend candidates apply as soon as possible.
After applying, you’ll receive an invitation to complete a HireVue assessment. Please complete it within 48 hours of submission.
To help us better understand your interests and career goals, we recommend candidates apply to their top 3–5 positions for the term.
Compensation
The expected hourly range for this role is $30 - $33 depending on experience and qualifications.

Student led team building events on a monthly basis
Employee discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis
